title: Sri Lanka’s population growth hits all-time low
byline: Sri Lanka is facing an astonishing decline in its growth rate with the percentage hitting an all-time low of 0.5 per cent since 1871, leading to social issues such as the shrinkage in the working age group and the increase in the aged population that will trigger challenges for policymakers to spend more on welfare and health.

title: jewellery valued Rs.3.8Mn stolen over rituals to dispel malefic effects
byline: A group of men who undertook to perform rituals to dispel malefic effects that had befallen a family had fled with jewellery valued at Rs. 3.8 million.

title: 4 dead, 4 injured in explosion at Kurunegala fuel station
byline: Four people, including the manager of a fuel station, died after a gas explosion in Wehera, Kurunegala late last night. Four others were injured, police said.

title: SLTB being subjected to planned destruction: Minister
byline: The Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) has been subjected to a planned destruction over the years, Minister of  Transport Bimal Ratnayake told Parliament today.

title: SC not going ahead with determination on VAT Amendment Bill
byline: The Supreme Court has informed Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne that it wil not come out with a determination on the Value Added Tax (VAT) Amendment Bill as the petitorners who challenged the Bill before courts have decided not to go ahead with the case.

title: Samantha Ranasinghe to Parliament in place of Kosala Jayaweera
byline: NPP candidate Samantha Ranasinghe who contested the general elections for the Kegalle District will replace MP Kosala Nuwan Jayaweera who died suddenly on Sunday.

title: 1,700 armed forces deserters arrested in crime crackdown: Minister
byline: Over the past two months, authorities have arrested nearly 1,700 individuals who had deserted the armed forces and have involved in organized criminal activities, Public Security Minister Ananda Wijepala said.

title: It’s heartening to know NPP has recognised reality regarding India: Eran
byline: It’s heartning to know that the NPP government has finally recognised the importance of India, former MP Eran Wickramaratne told an Indian TV channel today.

title: Colombo’s first fully automated terminal opens
byline: CWIT brings US $ 800mn boost to South Asia’s trade future

title: Modi’s aerial view of Ram Setu on his way back from SL coincides with Lord Ram’s birthday
byline: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi, on his way back from Sri Lanka, had a Darshan of Ram Setu, also known as Adam’s Bridge, a vast chain of natural limestone shoals that spans an impressive 30 miles (48 km) over the Indian Ocean.

title: Tourist arrivals up by 11.5% in first week of April
byline: Sri Lanka’s tourism sector kicked off April recording 38,615 tourist arrivals for the first six days of the month, which is a 11.5 percent year-on-year growth, the latest data from the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority showed.

title: Group of 103 Sri Lankan youth depart for hotel jobs in Israel
byline: A group of 103 Sri Lankan youth departed for Israel under the Israel Employment Programme to work in the hotel sector, the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) said.

title: Man injured in shooting in Seeduwa
byline: A 57-year-old man has been injured in a shooting incident in Seeduwa. Police said the victim was admitted to the Negombo Hospital for treatment.

title: No more extensions on ’Parate execution’ suspensions
byline: The Government will not further extend the suspension on ’Parate executions’ and it is effective now, Deputy Minister of Finance Harshana Suriyapperuma said today.

title: Namal Rajapaksa attends ’Rising Bharat Summit’ in New Delhi
byline: SLPP MP Namal Rajapaksa participated in the ’Rising Bharat Summit 2025’ in New Delhi today, which aims at strengthening trade, security, and diplomatic ties between India and Sri Lanka.

title: Adani Ports commences operations at Colombo West International Terminal in Sri Lanka
byline: Gautam Adani’s Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone Ltd (APSEZ) on Monday said it has commenced operations at Colombo West International Terminal in Sri Lanka.

title: Chamara Sampath Dasanayake granted bail
byline: Former Uva Provincial Councilor Chamara Sampath Dasanayake was released on bail today by Colombo Chief Magistrate Thanuja Lakmali on five sureties of Rs. Million 2 each with a cash bail of Rs. 50,000.

title: Rising cases in heart diseases
byline: Heart dieases is a leading cause of illness leading to deaths, affecting 60,000 people each year, and includes  conditions such as heart attacks, strokes and heart failure, said Senior Consultant Cardiologist Dr. Gotabaya Ranasinghe.

title: Trump threatens new 50% tariffs on China
byline: Donald Trump has threatened China with an extra 50% tariff on goods imported into the US if it does not withdraw its 34% counter-tariff, as global markets continue to fall.

title: 41 Kandy schools closed for security lodging from April 21–25
byline: The Zonal Education Office of Kandy has announced that selected schools will be used as lodgings for security forces personnel for four days, in view of the special exposition of the Sacred Tooth Relic at the Dalada Maligawa.

title: Government scraps SriLankan Airlines privatization plan
byline: The current government has decided to reverse the previous administration’s decision to privatize the airline, the President’s Media Division said.

title: Govt not safeguarding or preventing questioning of Easter attack suspects: Cabinet spokesman
byline: Cabinet Spokesman Nalinda Jayatissa today denied media reports claiming that members of the incumbent government are attempting to shield or prevent the questioning of individuals involved in the Easter Sunday bomb attacks.

title: Viyalendran fails to meet bail conditions, remains in remand
byline: Former Minister S. Viyalendran, who was released on bail in connection with a bribery incident, has been taken back into remand custody after failing to fulfill the conditions of his bail.

title: Proceeds of Crimes Bill approved by Parliament
byline: The  Proceeds of Crimes Bill under which the assets earned by wrong means could be acquired by the government was unanimously approved in Parliament today.

title: CSE surges past 15,000- mark with 467-point rally amid renewed optimism
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) staged a dramatic rebound on Thursday, with the All-Share Price Index (ASPI) soaring 467.26 points, or 3.19 percent, to close at 15,127.71, decisively breaching the critical 15,000 psychological barrier.

title: State Minister urges public to clap more for foreign reserve claim
byline: NPP State Minister Nalin Hewage urged the public gathered at a rally to cheer more enthusiastically for his claim on the increase in Treasury reserves.

title: President defends inquiry into elderly woman linked to fraud case
byline: Responding to criticism over ongoing investigations involving an elderly woman allegedly connected to a public fraud case, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said that age will not shield anyone from legal scrutiny if public funds are at stake.

title: TikTok expands parental controls to boost teen safety
byline: Popular social media platform, TikTok announced major updates to its Family Pairing tool on Sunday, granting parents enhanced oversight and teens tools to foster healthier digital habits.

title: Govt still pursuing Arjuna Mahendran’s return
byline: The government has not given up on bringing former Central Bank Governor Arjuna Mahendran back to the country at the first opportunity, Cabinet spokesman Nalinda Jayatissa said.

title: Tri-nation cricket series: Free entry for public
byline: Sri Lanka Cricket said that the upcoming Tri-Nation Women’s Series, featuring Sri Lanka, India and South Africa, will be open to the public free of charge.

title: Cabinet approves purchase of 15 mn ID card materials
byline: The Cabinet has approved the purchase of 15 million pre-printed polycarbonate cards for the issuing of National Identity Cards.

title: Cabinet nod to raise private sector minimum wage
byline: The Cabinet has granted its approval to increase the minimum wage for private sector employees with effect from April 1, 2025.

title: Former State Minister Sathasivam Viyalendran granted bail
byline: Former State Minister Sathasivam Viyalendran was granted bail today by Colombo Magistrate Thanuja Lakmali, with five sureties of Rs. 1 million each and a cash bail of Rs. 50,000.

title: Update: Man killed in shooting in Seeduwa
byline: A 57-year-old man was killed in a shooting incident in Seeduwa. Police said the victim died after being admitted to the Negombo Hospital for treatment.

title: President writes to Donald Trump over reciprocal tariffs
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake wrote to US President Donald Trump over the recently imposed reciprocal tariffs on Sri Lankan imports to the US, Minister of Labour Anil Jayantha Fernando said today.

title: Chicken, eggs prices increasing
byline: The prices of a kilogram of chicken and eggs appear to be increasing during the festive season, traders said.

title: Weather alert issued for multi-day boats in Southwest Bay
byline: Multi-day boats operating in the deep sea areas of southwest Bay of Bengal are advised to stay alert to future forecasts, as a low-pressure area currently in the region is likely to move north-north-westward over the next 24 hours, the Natural Hazards Early Warning Centre of the Meteorology Department said.

title: Parliament approves appointment of probe committee on IGP Tennakoon
byline: Parliament today approved a resolution to appoint a committee to investigate allegations against IGP Deshabandu Tennakoon.
